Interface ParamMap

All Known Subinterfaces:
NamedParamMap
All Known Implementing Classes:
MapNamedParamMap
public interface ParamMap

An object mapping parameter names (strings) to parameter (typed) values. Values are type by means of ParamMap.Type, whose constants are associated with Java types. Parameter values can be retrieved by name (with value(String)) or by name and ParamMap.Type (with value(String, Type)): with the latter, the actual runtime Java type of the returned value is the one associated with the provided Type. Typically, instances of this interface may be obtained by parsing a string, through the StringParser.parse(String) map, or by obtaining modified views of an existing ParamMap, e.g., through with(String, Type, Object) and without(String...) methods.

This interface also provides additional static methods to produce human-friendly representations of ParamMap objects.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static enum 
    ParamMap.Type
    The type of values that can be stored in a ParamMap.

  • Method Details

    • prettyToString

      static String prettyToString(ParamMap map)
      Returns a human-friendly string representation of the provided named map.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to be represented as string
      Returns:
      the string representation of the provided map

    • prettyToString

      static String prettyToString(ParamMap map, int maxLineLength)

      Returns a human-friendly string representation of the provided named map, possibly with indentation, depending on maxLineLength.

      Internally uses prettyToString(ParamMap, StringBuilder, int, int, int, String), with a blank space as indentation token, an indentation size of 2 tokens, and no offset.

      Parameters:
      map - the map to be represented as string
      maxLineLength - the maximum line length in the string representation, impacting also on
      Returns:
      the string representation of the provided map

    • prettyToString

      static void prettyToString(ParamMap map, StringBuilder stringBuilder, int maxLineLength, int indentOffset, int indentSize, String indentToken)

      Produces a human-friendly string representation of the provided named map and puts it in the provided StringBuilder. The string representation will have reasonable indentation according to the parameters maxLineLength, indentOffset, indentSize, and indentToken. The string representation will be parsable by the StringParser.parse(String) method: this method hence acts like a serialization method, while the mentioned parse() method acts like a deserialization method.

      If the provided map is a NamedParamMap, also the name of the map is represented in the string.

      Parameters:
      map - the map to be represented as string
      stringBuilder - the string builder to direct the representation to
      maxLineLength - the maximum line length in the string representation, impacting also on indentation style
      indentOffset - the offset for indentation (each line in the produced string representation will have indentOffset indentation tokens)
      indentSize - the number of indentation tokens to be used at each indentation
      indentToken - the indentation token (a blank indentToken being a reasonable value)

    • and

      default ParamMap and(ParamMap other)
      Returns a new ParamMap with all the parameters of this map and those of the provided other map. Hence, the set of names returned by names() is the union of the two sets. When retrieving a value, this map has the precedence over the other map.
      Parameters:
      other - the other ParamMap to get the values from
      Returns:
      a new ParamMap with all the parameters of this and the other maps

    • names

      Set<String> names()
      Returns the set of all the names (in no specified order) of the parameters stored in this map.
      Returns:
      the names of the parameters of this map

    • value

      <E extends Enum<E>> Object value(String name, ParamMap.Type type, Class<E> enumClass)

      Returns the value of the parameter stored in this map with the provided name and type, if any. The actual runtime Java type of the returned value is the one specified by type. If type is ParamMap.Type.ENUM or ParamMap.Type.ENUMS, enumClass has to be specified, otherwise enumClass is ignored.

      If the map contains a parameter with the provided name but with a different type than type, this method will return null.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of the (optional) enumeration
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the parameter to get the value of
      type - the type of the parameter
      enumClass - the (optional) class of the enumerated param value
      Returns:
      the value of the parameter with name name and type type, or null otherwise

    • value

      default Object value(String name, ParamMap.Type type)
      Returns the value of the parameter stored in this map with the provided name and type, if any. Works for all types different from ParamMap.Type.ENUM and ParamMap.Type.ENUMS. Internally calls value(String, Type, Class).
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the parameter to get the value of
      type - the type of the parameter
      Returns:
      the value of the parameter with name name and type type, or null otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if type is or ParamMap.Type.ENUM or ParamMap.Type.ENUMS

    • value

      default Object value(String name)
      Returns the value of the parameter stored in this map with the provided name, if any. If more than one types are compatible with the parameter value with this type (e.g., a natural number called n being compatible with both ParamMap.Type.INT and ParamMap.Type.DOUBLE), then the type which comes first in the order dictated by ParamMap.Type constants is chosen. Internally calls value(String, Type).
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the parameter to get the value of
      Returns:
      the value of the parameter with name name, or null otherwise

    • with

      default ParamMap with(String newName, ParamMap.Type newType, Object newValue)
      Returns a new ParamMap with all the parameters of this map and another parameter as provided. When retrieving a value, this map has the precedence over the provided parameter.
      Parameters:
      newName - the name of the new parameter
      newType - the type of the value of the new parameter
      newValue - the value of the new parameter
      Returns:
      a new ParamMap with all the parameters of this map and the new parameter

    • without

      default ParamMap without(String... names)
      Returns a new ParamMap with all the parameters of this map which have not a name included in the provided names.
      Parameters:
      names - the names of parameters to be excluded from the new map
      Returns:
      a new ParamMap with all the parameters of this map which have not a name included in the provided names
